newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Ivorian cocoa mid-crop near 100,000 T - Minister.
newsitem.headline: Ivorian cocoa mid-crop near 100,000 T - Minister.

text.p: The Ivory Coast's upcoming cocoa crop, known as the mid-crop, will be somewhere near 100,000 tonnes, the country's Minister for Commodities, Guy-Alain Gauze, said on Friday.

"It is not a big crop, around 100,000 tonnes," Gauze told Reuters during a meeting between the European Union and African, Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) countries to discuss reforms to the Lome Convention.
Gauze stressed that the forecast for the crop was a preliminary one and that not all estimates had been received by the authorities in Abidjan.

Estimates in the market have ranged from 100,000 tonnes to as high as 160,000 tonnes, and the Ivorian government's own forecasts are traditionally on the conservative side. But all estimates are well below last year's bumper 200,000-tonne crop.
The prospect of a lower mid-crop this season, combined with reports of small bean sizes, have fuelled fears of a tight supply situation on international markets this summer.
